Reviews.Title: Another great camera in the Fuji line-up
Reviews.Author: Yarii
Reviews.Content: I love Fuji cameras, this is my 9th one!  This camera takes the best of the former Z-series cameras, (except this model is not waterproof), and combines it with an affordable price and HD movie capability.I love the fit and finish on this camera (I own the black one).  The lens is protected by a sliding cover which also powers the camera on and off.  It is sleek-looking and it's rare to find a fairly inexpensive camera that is made of METAL nowadays.  The lens zooms in and out INSIDE the camera so you don't have to be as careful when you handle this.  Unless you drop it you probably won't get a zoom error that commonly happens with cameras where the lens protrudes outward when the power is turned on.One thing I like better about this Z70 than some of the older Z series is the USB connector on this camera is not located inside the battery compartment, it's on the side of the camera where it should be.  The older Z30 (and some of the other Z's) had the USB inside the battery compartment and that would have eventually caused the battery door to wear out from constantly opening/closing it.I didn't care for the buttons on the older Z cameras as they were too close together and it was easy to press the incorrect button, this new Z70 looks more like a conventional digital camera on the back, and the buttons are lit up, so if you're taking pictures in a dimly lit area, it's easier to see the buttons to press.  I also like the feature that you can instantly turn it on to take a movie, there is a button on top - you just press it and start filming, it's next to the shutter release button.My only complaint with this camera is the start-up time when you first slide the lens cover open. It feels like a 3 or 4 second wait. So if that is a concern for you, you may want to avoid this camera, or just leave the lens cover open (but it may get scratched if you do).Pictures are sharp and the colors are, if anything, a little brighter than normal, but I like that. Response time after taking a picture without using the flash was just about a second; response time between pictures with the flash firing was around 2 seconds or less before ready to take another flash shot...this was a lot better than some other cameras I've tried recently.  Response time also depends on the class of your SD card.The optical wide angle zoom on this camera is 5X (most cheaper cameras have  3X). It uses the standard NP45 lithium battery. I was able to shoot around 200 pictures and some short movies before it needed recharging - the plug-in battery charger comes with this and you can fully recharge the battery in under an hour.  I love the lithium battery over AA-type batteries because you get so many more shots out of one charging.  You just have to plan ahead in case you are going somewhere so you have a fully charged battery, or buy a spare.You can take the camera out of the box and be taking pictures as soon as the battery charges. SR-Auto automatically senses the scene and adjusts itself accordingly: Portrait, Landscape, Night, Macro, Backlit Portrait, or Night Portrait.  There is no dial to change settings, everything is accessed thorough menu navigation, except for the movie button which is on top of the camera.This camera has a new feature called AF Tracking, which helps keep the subject in focus while the subject is moving.  This works well sometimes, and at other times it doesn't.  Sometimes I think it's "just me" not holding the shutter button down correctly so this will work the way it's intended. To have it work correctly, you have to remember to hold the shutter button down halfway, while continually keeping the subject in the LCD screen.This camera has Image Stabilization (somehow built into the camera's software), but it is NOT optical stabilization.  Also you can choose this in the set-up menu to be "on" all the time, unlike other previous (cheaper) Fuji models, which is a definite improvement.Next, you have your movie modes - 3 to choose from - HD, 640 and 320 in the AVI format.  The HD video with this camera is just as good visually as my Flip Mino HD camcorder.  Optical zoom needs to be set before recording starts, it cannot be changed after the button is pushed.  Focus is also set when recording begins, but exposure and white balance are constantly adjusting during the recording.If you want to play the movies back on your TV, you will need to purchase an additional A/V cable (AV-C1) if you don't already own one. If you want to play an HD movie back on your HDTV, you will need to purchase an additional HDMI cable. There is also an optional Model HDP-L1 player available on Fujifilm's web site, which includes an HD card reader and a remote. Since I don't have an HDTV myself, I didn't purchase this so I can't comment on it.This camera comes with very basic Fuji MyFinepixViewer photo editing software. It's compatible with Windows 7, Vista, XP and Mac. This is a new version of the Fuji software and it's better than the previous, but still not as good as Picasa.This camera has only 13 MB of internal memory, so pick up an SD card if you don't already have one.

Reviews.Title: What do you expect for under $150 buck?
Reviews.Author: J. Sariya "AZN electro"
Reviews.Content: A lot apparently. I did some fishing around the net before I brought this camera. Not much info out there really. So I went to best buy and played with it a bit. I was not that impressed. But when I compared it to the other product in the same price range (as well as more expensive), it did stand out. After I got mine, I toyed with setting and read the menu, I'm loving it. Picture is very clear and in the same time very forgiving regarding imperfection on you face. HD movie looks great,very smooth, sound is good too. Just remember a mic is attached to the camera, you only going to give clear sound when you are close to it. I always been a Sony kind of guy, but now I think I'm in love with Fuji :)

Reviews.Title: CLEAR
Reviews.Author: **Movie Reviewer**
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of the price and since it can take HD VIDEO in 720p. Lets get to the deal breakers that I was unable to find anywhere I looked, unlike most camera that can take video, this one records in AVI format, not the MP4 / MOV. I like AVI because I can edit it very easily. AVI files cannot exceed 2GB in size, let it be on any camera or computer. On this camera you can zoom in and out while filming. A nice feature of this camera is the battery, its rechargeable. You can't recharge the battery while its in the camera, it comes with a separate charger and you need to take the battery out of the camera, I like this idea as I can buy multiple batteries and charge one yet still use the camera...Camera takes both SD & SDHC memory cards, if you do not have a computer drive that can read the more newer SDHC cards, the camera comes with a USB cable so you can transfer the photos/videos that way with or without using the included cd-rom. This camera has a ton of setting on it, so many I had to look through the manual thats on the cd-rom as icons were popping up on the camera screen that I did not know what they meant. My favorite feature of this camera is that it can take 2 pictures at a time, one with the flash and then one without so you can pick which one is better. The camera has other features too, but I have not yet played with them enough to see what they do. In terms of weight and feel, its solid, has a good weight to it so it does not feel like cheap plasic, parts of the outside are metal. It has a port on the bottom for a standard tripod. On this camera, don't worry if you break the battery / memory card off because it does not rely on that to keep the battery or memory card in place, I know lots of people worry about that...I had other camera with the same megapixel rating and the battery life was horrible! On this camera you can take many many pictures and HD Video with power to spare. Keep in mind though, I noticed some settings this camera has does indeed use more power (the fully automatic scene recognizer, dual image taker as I mentioned earlier) and flash usage all will vary the life of the battery before you need another recharge, the battery can recharge to maximum capacity in about 2hours. The pictures and video come out really clear. This is my first FUJI camera, I usually get KODAK & CANNON and I think I will always buy FUJI from now on. I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: A good compact camera in the under $100 price range
Reviews.Author: W. Otto "Laser Brain"
Reviews.Content: Pros: - great pictures - audio notes/comments - the lens does not telescope out from the case - good low light performance - large screen, but still room for buttons - great video - natural light/flash dual modeCons - like all compact cameras, resolution is limited to about 3-5 MP - Under low light levels, auto white balance can be slightly off - no panoramic mode - no histogram - a little slow to turn on and store images - the audio notes is difficult to accessNOTE TO THOSE WHO DISPLAY PICTURES AT 100% ON THE COMPUTER SCREEN:THE LIMIT OF RESOLUTION IS ABOUT 5MP FOR A COMPACT CAMERAFirst my standard comments about compact cameras with these tiny sensors (1/2.33") - it is easy to show (I am an optical physicist, so at least it is easy for me) that it is physically impossible to get 12 MP resolution even if the lenses were perfect. In fact, the theoretical limit under the most perfect conditions is about 9 MP for this size lens. However, under average lighting conditions and lens settings, you can expect 3 to 4 times less. For example my test shots show about 2MP resolution for the Exilim z75 and nearly 4MP for the Fuji Z70. So if you think you want to get a 12 MP camera as an upgrade to your 5 MP camera or even 3 MP camera, save your money. You need a bigger and much better lens. The high-end Canon SD4000is camera actually achieves 5MP with a larger lens, under ideal conditions, based on measurements. If you want a real upgrade in a pocket camera, look there. Contrast this with a full frame 35 mm DSLR. The theoretical limit is well over 100 MP and the achievable real life resolution is 8 MP, based on actual measurements with a Nikon D3s.WHY DO THEY PUT 12 MP SENSOR IN A CAMERA THAT CAN'T POSSIBLY TAKE A 12MP PICTURE?There are two reasons. The first is that 12MP sensors are cheap nowadays and you'd rather buy a camera that says "12MP sensor" than "5MP sensor." Admit it, you would. But there is a second reason to have twice as many pixels as the measured horizontal and vertical resolution. Some things are on a diagonal. So you need more pixels. The other thing is, the pixels are not "color" pixels but either red, green or blue. In theory you need about 3 times as many pixels to get color pictures. But in reality, the camera processor synthesizes a color picture from fewer pixels by making good guesses about what the color of something is. So the bottom line is you probably need about twice as many pixels as the actual resolution limit. That means about 5 MP for a low end compact camera and about 10 MP for a higher end compact camera, and 16 MP for a high end full frame DSLR. So, in the Finepix Z70, 8MP would have been enough to get all the performance you'll ever get out of this one. The test photos (see comments) indicate that the FinePix Z70 easily beat the Exilim resolution and is close to 4 MP of resolution.THIS CAMERA (LIKE MOST COMPACT POINT AND SHOOT MODELS) LETS YOU TAKE A PICTURE EVEN WHEN IT IS GOING TO BE HOPELESSLY BLURREDThe second drawback to the inexpensive compact cameras is the small lenses and cheap sensors combined with the point and shoot approach, can result in the user trying to take pictures under impossible conditions. The camera probably warns you with an icon in the viewscreen (such as a shakey hand) but you will ignore it and take the picture anyway and be disappointed and blame the camera. Indoors at night in natural light is always going to result in a picture with a lot of digital noise and probably a bit blurred as well.  The flashes in these cameras are very low power because there is not a huge battery in the camera, so you really can't take acceptable flash pictures more than a few feet away. It is unrealistic to expect any pocket camera to take great pictures at a party. The best you can hope for are the typical flash pictures that have bright foregrounds and very dark backgrounds. With a stabilized DSLR at high ISO and a nice f/1.4 lens, you can do natural light shots that compact cameras can only dream of. One way around this, is that the higher end compact cameras now take several short exposures and do a shift and add to synthesize a single picture. If things (other than your hand) aren't moving much, this trick works well, especially if you have optical stabilization. If you want to take low light level pictures in natural light, I suggest you look at the Sony DSC-TX7 or the Canon SD4000is or similar $300+ cameras. By contrast, a modern SLR can offer ISO ratings of several thousand, (compared to a few hundred for a pocket point and shoot) enabling handheld shots under low light conditions.BASED ON THE Z700This camera, the Z70, is the non-touch screen version of the Z700 and has a cheaper sensor and a cheaper processor. The Z700 in turn, is "inspired" by the Sony DSC-TX7 which I have also reviewed. The Fuji lacks the panoramic mode, the high dynamic range mode, and the exceptional low light mode of the Sony, but it is about half the price. Of course, the Z70 is about 1/3 the price, so, do not expect anything approaching the performance of the more expensive models. That said, the performance is very decent for a $100 camera.PERFORMANCECompared to cameras in its class, the Finepix does a fine job in bright light. I personally like the buttons better than the touchscreen, but you may feel differently. As in all my reviews, I have taken pictures of nearly identical scenes for comparison and posted them. Amazon tends to remove my links from the reviews, however. So let me say again that the resolution was easily 4 MP worth meaning about 1800 vertical lines. The 5x zoom range also beats some other low priced cameras.In bright daylight, the pictures are generally excellent. They are perhaps slightly saturated, reminding me of Agfachrome film, but very pleasing. This camera does not have a sophisticated multi-point metering systems, so I sometimes have to adjust the exposure up or down 2/3 of a stop. Be very careful, because it sets the exposure according to whatever is in the cross-hairs of the viewfinder.There is a sunset mode which allows you to take realistic exposures and not having the white balance messed up by trying to correct the scene to daylight. If you have tried to take sunset pictures with a point and shoot camera before and been disappointed, then this feature is for you.Under low light conditions, a fairly usable picture can be taken, if the camera is steadied, and you do not zoom in. The automatic white balance occasionally seems to do a poor job under low-level incandescent lighting, which you can override for stills, but movies are always in automatic white balance mode, so they can sometimes come out looking slightly yellowish under these conditions.Like most users, I tend to use this in the fully auto mode, but, unlike many point and shoot cameras, there is a "program" mode in which you can still adjust the exposure up or down from the metered value.I find that a 4 GB SD card is big enough for me, but I don't take a lot of video. If you do, you might want to go larger. The battery life is better than average which means more than 150 pictures per charge (a mixture of flash and non-flash pictures). The USB connector is a non-standard one, so make sure you don't lose it.I always respond to comments, so don't be bashful. If you only have $100 to spend and want a shirt pocket camera, this might be for you. I used to say I preferred my Casio, but I have changed my mind. After a year of using the FinePix z70, it is my favorite tiny camera.I have updated this review from my initial review of Jan 2011. What I have learned is that the auto white balance is usually good, and that the exposure compensation is actually pretty handy and works well. Also, the "night" shooting mode is what you want to use whenever you have low light conditions. Automatic scene recognition is good if you want to let the camera do all of the thinking, but you get no control over your picture at all. I also now have a Canon T3i DSLR - shooting with big image stabilized lenses and ISO 3200, the DSLR allows me to take very acceptable photos in very low light indoors hand held. Do not expect to come anywhere close to this with a pocket camera, with lenses that are only 5 mm in diameter, compared to the 50mm diameter lenses on a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: First Fujifilm Camera, and satisfied (:
Reviews.Author: Byoung K. Lee "Luchii"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera for everyday use. The picture quality is great as well as the variety modes for each type of event/scenery. The interface is a bit difficult to get used to, but I got used to it pretty quick even though I believe that its interface should be more user-friendly. The color is really pretty. it's like magenta/red, prettier than the picture on the website. The shipping was also really quick. I got the item in just two days.Pictures are very clear and pretty. it holds off person's flaws pretty well. moving face-detection is a great feature. I used Sony Cybershot in the past and wasn't very satisfied with the camera. It was heavy and bulky that made it hard for me to use it for everyday use. Fujifilm Finepix Z70 is lightweight and thin camera that's smaller than my blackberry. It's great for everyday use and just require a bit space in your purse or pocket. video quality is really nice to. VERY CLEAR. can't be more satisfied with this product with exception of the user interface. But the basic camera capabilities are extremely satisfying.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the money!!!
Reviews.Author: cheffy
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera when it first came out to replace the Fuji Z5 that my roommate lost.  Overall I am impressed with the ease and quality of this camera.  The price has dropped and at the recent price points it has got to be the best camera out there for the money.  There are so many features I have not even used (I don't shoot a lot of videos), but the camera features excel, and if you have owned a Fuji in the past, it takes just a few seconds to get used to the buttons.I used the auction feature, and if you have to put something on craigslist or ebay it is an amazing feature.I put my photos on a slide show on my 32 inch HDTV and all I say is wow!!!  Buy the camera, enjoy the quality construction, ease of use and overall amazing photos!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Digital Camera!
Reviews.Author: Dayanna Lobo
Reviews.Content: Very good digital camera. It has a small size, she is very comfortable and it has an image high resolution. It has a very easy and practical menu. It is of metal and the color is very pretty. First Fuji camera is my and the truth very happy and I am satisfied with the product. I like a lot. I recommend it extensively.

Reviews.Title: Wanted so badly for this camera to be great
Reviews.Author: Missteach123
Reviews.Content: I loved the apperence of this camera! I loved the slide down power on feature! I loved the 5X zoomed! So I bought it! I had this camera about 45 days when I got these wierd looking lines that looked like black tears in the screen. It was wierd. They weren't just black lines they were a little jagged. So, I returned the camera to the store I bought it from and evenly exchanged it for the same camera! Well about only 30 days with this camera and the same stupid thing happened again. I always kept the camera in a camera case, so I don't know why the screen kept doing this. Along with the black lines, some of the pictures came out blury! Image stabilization...my foot...when the image was stable and clear the photo would come out blury. More like reverse image stabilization. I just returned the 2nd go at this camera to the store and returned it for a Sony. I'm bummed!

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: Heather1225
Reviews.Content: I seem to go through a lot of cameras...I got this one after a cheap one from Walmart broke on me.  I love the color of it, the size, the picture quality and the price.  Cant say to many things bad about this camera, seems as if it might go dead easily, you have to make sure that you slide the lens cover back up and the little switch on the battery cover stays closed.  Other than that and those things arent bad just things you have to make sure you do.  Hoping this camera lasts longer than the rest.  Think im sticking with Fuji from now on though, love this product!!

Reviews.Title: Stopped working within 3 days of arriving!
Reviews.Author: Janine Mergler
Reviews.Content: This was sent to me through the post... worked beautifully for 3 DAYS!!!! Then when you opened it, it did not seem to recognise daylight and went to night mode... the picture was completely black. Called Fuji and after a number of questions and trouble shooting attempts the tech there said the 'sensor' was not recognising daylight... VERY UNHAPPY!! Returned to Amazon for a refund... fingers crossed!

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: Mons
Reviews.Content: This camera was what I had hoped to be a good one. Looks great, works good and takes great pictures and video. After about 3 months I had a black line in my LCD screen the last day amazon tool it back as a return. I called the company and talked to them the turn around was 8 weeks and they said this was a problem that always happeneds and would happen again. I called amazon and the lady was very nice refunded my money before I sent the camera off so it would be refunded as the full amount and not 50% very happy with amazon that's why I do most of my shopping here

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Todd Brewer "Design Dragon"
Reviews.Content: I had a larger, digital SLR years ago by Fuji - and picked this one up just to carry in my pocket, deciding to hand down my Nikon L11 to my kids. This is a great little camera and takes fantasitc pics. The ion battery lasts about 7 hours or so under pretty continuous use, so I'm picking up a spare.Being able to upload directly to youtube and facebook, as well as the ability to shoot HD video in such a compact camera is wonderful and for the price, really can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: Didn't last long, terrible customer service
Reviews.Author: Zero Fret
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera on 12/2/11. I used the camera for Christmas pictures, then stuck it in my camera bag, where I left it for over a month. On 2/2/12 I took it from the bag intending to use it. I discovered that the LCD screen had a dime sized fully blacked out circular area on it, plus a line of blacked out pixels running from the center of the screen over to the right hand side. So this is the first problem, the camera went defective in only 2 months and with really only one day's actual use on it.The second problem was with Fujifilm's so-called customer support and Fujifilm's customer hostile warranty policies. I called the number provided in the camera's box to find out how to get the camera repaired. They gave me an address to ship it to, but when I asked them how they were going to reimburse me for the cost of shipping it to them, I was told that it was Fujifilm's policy that the customer just had to eat this cost. When I started to protest this, the support person hung up on me.It is my belief that any ethical company would take the steps necessary to ensure that their customers are not out any additional costs due to the company's failure to produce a decent product. Fujifilm's policy of refusing to reimburse this cost displays a genuine contempt for the customer. I will probably be stuck paying for Fujifilm's shoddy workmanship here, but I can assure you that I will never again purchase anything made by Fujifilm. I highly recommend others to do likewise. A company that treats their customers badly doesn't deserve to have any customers.

Reviews.Title: beautiful but crappy!
Reviews.Author: Gamergirl
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is beautiful. So different from the rest of a typcal point and shoot. The buttons on the back even light up pretty. cosmetically the camera ia sexy!! I love the sliding down front! Im giving it 2 stars cause its pretty, different from the normal camera and the returning was easy enough to handle!However, its not worth the money for it to just "look pretty".I found that you NEED a tri-pod or a table to take a clear shot without a flash on. Even with great lighting if the flash is off, regardless of shooting mode, it blurs! And blurs BAD!If the flash is on it takes much better pictures but even then it blurs at times.Im not a shaky person, though im not as steady as a table! The camera should be able to ajust. My old Kodak can if i can keep it charged!!I also found that if the lighting is good and the flash is on the picture looks almost over exposed and the color is off! I have a chocolate poodle and in some pictures she was more red and our brown carpet was pinkish.Faces are ghost white almost as if you took the picture standing a foot from them.I understand this isnt the top of the line camera. Your not going to get FANTASTIC photos from a $100 point n shoot. But, they should be good and clear. My expierence with this camera was terrible and i wouldnt recommend it to ANYONE!!I had this for 6 days and  sent it back it was that bad!Another issue i had that was tolerable but very annoying, the beeping on the camera. It does get annoying. I turned it off and it turns the flash off! Im not sure what a flash and a beep noise has anything to with one another but it does. Its says "hold the disp. (display  button to turn flash on" but when i did this.. nothing happened! I had to go through the menus and turn it on the long way. Again, this was annoying but tolerable! If this was the only problems with on the camera i wouldve considered keeping it.In my opinion you buy a camera to take pictures and capture the moments you want to remember. This camera was almost incapable of taking a clear picture! Most of the time people looked like ghosts or a giant blurr!I was thinking of just trying a different series of the fujifilm finepix but not sure if i want to go through the hassle of this again. It was easier then i expected to return and get my refund but still an inconvience!

Reviews.Title: Makes a lovely paper weight
Reviews.Author: Katie_B
Reviews.Content: I have never hated a camera more in my life. I love Fuji, but I do not love this camera,  I would love nothing more than to smash it with a hammer after all of the frustration I have endured. First off, I don't know why it has different shooting modes because they all look the same in the end, like crap. The bottom battery door is constantly flying open because of the terrible design.  If it's in my purse I'll randomly hear it turn on because somehow the sliding portion was bumped, then suddenly you have no battery left. If you want to take pictures one after the other (this was no issue with my old fuji from like 2001) that's not going to happen or this camera will have a mini breakdown and just turn off. I don't think I like anything about this camera other than it doesn't take batteries. I've resorted to my iphone for all of my pictures, I don't even know what to do with this terrible little camera other than use it as a paper weight.

Reviews.Title: Nice small camera
Reviews.Author: Darlene M. Bayne
Reviews.Content: This is a nice digital camera to carry around with you.  Takes good pictures and is easy to use.  I just carry it with me all the time to take everyday shots.  Pictures are sharp, crisp focus with good color.

Reviews.Title: Easy
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Reviews on line was the final straw that made me purchase this camara. It is very easy to use and downloads pics. I took 12 and had no problem sending them to a friend. Well I should say it allowed me to send no more then 10 at a time. But that was not a huge problem. With free shipping and low prices why go anywhere els to purchase. I will buy at Ammazon and feel secure with my purchase

Reviews.Title: Compact yet, big in features
Reviews.Author: FUJI LOYALIST
Reviews.Content: Quick to adjust focus. Easy to operate and carry around. Video recording on HD is wonderful. My wife loves ir because it has the option for Japanese language!

Reviews.Title: Great and cute - good price too!
Reviews.Author: nymom
Reviews.Content: I have really enjoyed this camera.  It takes great pictures and is easy to use.  I have not really tried playing with the settings much, but it has served my purposes well.  Of course, you have to make sure to buy a memory card too when you get it.  That might be obvious to everyone, but I just thought it was worth mentioning.

Reviews.Title: My Camera is Fantastic and Beautiful
Reviews.Author: Norma Cordova "Kasana"
Reviews.Content: I have two Fujifilm FinePixZ70 digital camera, I love them and they are easy to use, that's what I like more. These cameras are beautiful and delicate with very pretty colors. The pictures are clear and with good colors too.I am very satisfied with my Fuji's.

Reviews.Title: Camera review
Reviews.Author: Mackenzie mg
Reviews.Content: A great camera! Takes great pics, and is fast and durable! The only downside isU can't just shove it in your pocket because the slidy thing may openTurning the camera on. Other than that, I freaking love this camera!

Reviews.Title: FUJI is definitely the best!!!
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann Donadt
Reviews.Content: I had an older model of a Fuji Finepix and lost it during a trip to Venice...I was so disappointed!!! Once back home, I tried to get a newer model but found it a bit pricey, or at least much more than I meant to spend. Not much later, my mother-in-law gave me a NIkon Coolpix touch (I don't remember the model now but it is one of the most sophisticated) as a birthday present and I must confess I never got to grips with it...Nikon is a top brand but I never got used to this model and my pics came out either blurred or out of focus (put the blame on my pulse!!)Whatever, I came across this Fuji camera and decided to get it and give my teenage kids the Nikon...I don't regret the change. On the contrary,I'm elated to have the best quality pictures I used to have. Great product and value for money!!

Reviews.Title: Great video but hate the wait.
Reviews.Author: Joneez
Reviews.Content: I've owned both a Z1 and a Z5 and loved them both. I bought the Z70 looking for the next step up and in some ways it is. The added pixels are great as is the SD card instead of the ridiculous XD. But my favorite thing with the Z1/Z5 was taking short videos at car and motorcycle races. The Z1/Z5 had a pic/vid switch on top and you could power on in either mode in about 2 seconds. With the Z70 though, you have to power on in the pic mode then press the vid button. It takes about 3 sec to power on then another 3 sec to start rolling vid. So you're looking at 6 sec to take a vid instead of the Z1/Z5's 2 sec. This is a big deal to me because 4 sec is a long time in motorsports. On the other hand, the vids look and sound fantastic and unlike reported by other reviewers, my Z70 will zoom during vids.Taking pics with the Z70 makes you look like a pro. With practice and the right settings I can freeze or blur action as I please and take beautiful close-ups. Just what I've come to expect from a Fuji.To me it feels like the Z70's trying to do too many things at once and that just slows it down, so I'm giving a 3 star rating because the time delay is almost inexcusable and I know Fuji can do better.

Reviews.Title: Excelent Camara
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: This cam is excelent, the best price for design. You can take photos with excelent color and definition. The HD video es very usefull. I think i did a excelent choise.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: Happy Mom
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 15 year old daughter for her birthday and I am so thrilled with the quality of the pictures. It is easy to use and she loves it.

Reviews.Title: Fuji Film 70
Reviews.Author: K. Jewell
Reviews.Content: The camera is sleek and has a fast start up, but, the photo lens face plate slips up too easily turning on the camera in your pocket (this can be obverted once you are aware of the possibility).  Likewise the battery compartment lock comes undone easily in your pocket which mean the little fragile door could be destroyed, and the photo review button (play) is easily depressed while in your pocket and turns the camera on inadvertently killing the battery and causing you to miss "that shot".I've noticed that although I'm in auto focus mode, a lot of my photos are blurry.  I do point at my subject of the photo and half depress the shot button for the camera to focus and wait for the camera to stop "buzzing and bleeping" before I take the shot, so I don't know what the deal is here.  Yes, the lens is clean...derrr!If you are a camera wiz and know why my problems are so problematic, then you can surely look beyond these minor problems and enjoy a sleek glossy black camera that may take awesome pictures and have amazing battery life.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a great price
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice little camera.  Small enoough to fit in my pocket, easy to use, pretty color, and great price.

Reviews.Title: FujiFilm Finepix Z70
Reviews.Author: Cilla
Reviews.Content: This is a review, from a long running fujifilm user. I, like others really wanted this camera to perform amazingly. I got it within the first week it was out. I went from a Fujifilm s700 to this finepix Z70. As soon as I started using it, I did not like it. But the s700 is a bigger camera and thought "maybe I just need to adjust to it, learn its tricks". But alas NO. If you live in a house or apartment with medium lighting, you're still out of luck. I will say that in direct sunlight, it works pretty well. But if you're indoors, with average lighting, you can expect, blurry and grainy photos. For dim light shooting, don't even bother. So unless you spend all your time outside and that's your primary use, do not waste your time.The one feature that grabbed me was the HD video option. But like I said before, your typical lighting will do nothing for the HD feature. And if it doesn't focus right when the video starts, you will have a blurry, unfocused video. I gave this camera 2 stars because in bright lighting, it works well. Also within 2 months, the battery hatch gave out and I have to rig it to keep the battery in. Sad fact that I sold my s700 just to buy this thing. If i could go back, i'd keep my giant s700, the quality was better, I just wanted something I could throw in my purse.But now, giant purses are in season, so take your money, skip this camera and go buy an s700! Sure you might look like a tourist, but your picture quality will be so much better!!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera, good looking too!
Reviews.Author: carlos garcia
Reviews.Content: As described got a great  deal,as far a s camera goes its very easy to use and convenient was very happy.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy
Reviews.Author: carmen maracara
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from Amazon and just two months after he damaged the menu button, I think it has to do with the way on, for what it takes to slide the front. He turns on the video recording function continuously when I want to take a picture. Do not buy.

Reviews.Title: Decent Buy For The Money
Reviews.Author: Al Harvey
Reviews.Content: I bought this to take with us on vacation becuase our other camera broke. It is primarily for my wife to use and she seems to like it. No majors issues and a good buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: Meh
Reviews.Author: S. Williamson
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, a lot of features, but I have a hard time getting the color balance right. They often come out too light or too dark. As a mom who often gets one chance to take a shot before the kids have moved on, that was a bummer. It works much better outside. The size is great for carrying in my bag. But it sure isn't replacing my much older (like 10 year old) camera by any stretch.

Reviews.Title: great inspection camera
Reviews.Author: Tim Rose
Reviews.Content: i have owned four of these cameras I am a home inspector an take around 250 pics a day with flash in crawlspaces and attics  the camera is well built and has a cover that keeps dirt and dust from  the lens area the lens is fixed which is why i purchase this camera  after about 6 months the flash starts to over flash and have to replace unitBut for the price its a good deal

Reviews.Title: Nature picture with little zoom are more then perfect for this price of camera but..
Reviews.Author: Kristiina
Reviews.Content: ..that is it. Taking pictures inside even with daylight the quality is bad. Most of the pictures come out blurry. Taking picture with night time with lights are awful. 1/10 picture maybe came out acceptable but not good. Without any light I never couldn't get any good picture. I wish I would add little more money and would get many times better camera.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures but.....
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a few weeks ago and upon recieving it i loved it. This camera takes great pics.Last week the slide shutter wasnt working properly. Needless to say im sending it back to amazon tomorrow. I am goin to purchase a diff camera.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: Purchased this as a Christmas present for daughter.  She loves it and has taken many great pictures.  May not be as durable as some cameras as she dropped it and cracked the case.

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware.
Reviews.Author: R. Carlos "Stylish Mommy"
Reviews.Content: This camera was a bad purchase. I had it for over a year and all of my pics from that time are out of focus. I have had many cameras over the years, expensive and cheap, this was the worst yet. A few months after I purchased it, it stopped working. I had to send it in to be repaired. There are great cameras out there, this is just not one.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: KBSauer
Reviews.Content: Definatly a great camera for under $50 shipped. It works great, easy to use and very portable. Love it and would buy another if need be.

Reviews.Title: Nice design and build quality, decent photos, bad LCD
Reviews.Author: Christopher Leung
Reviews.Content: I've owned 3 Fujifilm digital cameras, and all of them have been good to great cameras: A210, S5200, HS10This Z70 model is a nice looking, super compact camera with a non-extending lens. The body feels pretty sturdy. It seems to contain more metal than plastic, which is a good thing in my opinion.It's pretty easy to use. Just slide down the cover, and it turns on pretty fast. The 5x zoom lens is nice, and the 720p HD video recording also works great. Audio is clear, and video has a minimal amount of blocking and other artifacts. You can even zoom while recording, although it takes a second to refocus, and there's a soft humming noise from the lens motor. Nothing overly annoying, though.If you're outside during the daytime, this camera takes some pretty good photos. It focuses fast, and there's not too much noise in the photos.Although it has a flash, the camera tends to have has a very hard time focusing while indoors, at night, or in any other kind of low-light situation. Plus it doesn't have any kind of focus assist light to help it "see" better. While your eyes might adjust to the low light, this camera doesn't.You're trading some low-light image quality for a super compact form factor and good build quality.This downside wouldn't be that big of a deal if it wasn't for the faulty LCD screen. I had this camera for about 4 months, and all of a sudden a patch of dead pixels appeared on the LCD screen. I ended up shipping it back to Fuji and having it repaired under warranty. The $4 to ship it to the repair center wasn't too bad, and I got the camera back in about a week and a half, if I remember correctly. They even threw in a sheet that had a discount code for an online order of prints. Unfortunately, it seems the LCD panels they are using are faulty, as the camera's screen has yet another blotch of dead pixels on it, and it's now out of warranty.From the reviews, it seems I'm not the only one with LCD quality issues. This camera has been disappointing. With the combination of bad low-light performance and iffy component quality, I'd avoid this model and get a different camera.

Reviews.Title: Worth what I paid for it
Reviews.Author: Ron "mvg@whidbey.com"
Reviews.Content: I received this as a 25-years of service award from my company and am unhappy with it. It doesn't seem to be able to focus well and although the slide-down power on feature is interesting, I found it too easy to leave it down, thus draining the battery (yes, user error.)

Reviews.Title: Finepix Z70
Reviews.Author: Emmy
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, and good picture quality. Also easy to use camera software. Most of my pictures taken with this camera turn out good.

Reviews.Title: Great Value for the Price
Reviews.Author: Weekend Warrior
Reviews.Content: I have been satisfied with my purchase for this camera.  It does not always take perfect pictures but 90% of the time I get good looking pictures.  The shutter is a little slow but does not bother me that much.  Only thing that I could be disappointed with is while recording video, zooming in and out makes a lot of noise on the captured video as well when fully zoomed in video mode it does not focus fully.  Also the battery door wiggles loose and flops open sometimes.  Other than that I have been fully satisfied with the camera, however I would not pay 80 to 100.  50-70$ is the value of this camera.

Reviews.Title: great!
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: I just bought the camera and so far it is great! i originally bought this camera because it does not have a pop out lens and previously i had 3 cameras that broke because of lens problem. I am very happy with this camera and its a great great price!

Reviews.Title: Good P&S; Camera
Reviews.Author: Samwise "Samwise"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as we have a new baby and I wanted something I could slip in a pocket on the go.  This camera is very slim and easy to operate.  I can literally just pop it in my pocket and go.  My favorite feature is that it turns on by sliding the front part down - feel like this protects the viewfinder and also keeps it from turning on accidentally and wasting battery.  I like that the battery and memory card are in a slot that has a little latch to clasp shut, though it sometimes will pop open by accidentally brushing across the latch.  I wish there was a way to recharge the battery without having to take it out, but it's really not a trouble.  It does not use any other type of battery.  The only thing I really don't like about it is that it seems you have to use the flash in order to get a clear picture.  If I don't use the flash then it doesn't focus on the subject and the image is blurry.  Not sure yet if I can work around that somehow.  Overall, a great value.

Reviews.Title: Good For Price
Reviews.Author: TamaSamoa684
Reviews.Content: The camera is really nice. I really like the camera quality. one other thing is that most of the features are automatic so there isnt much of a hassel

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: gardengal
Reviews.Content: This camera is hard to misplace,with it's bright raspberry color! It is smaller than my last one and fits in my pocket easier.The pictures are nice and clear,and colors bright.

Reviews.Title: alright
Reviews.Author: Washington
Reviews.Content: I have Digital SLR and bought this camera as a christmas present for my gf just because of the design.it looks very nice and easy to use but the picture quality is not too great. but it's nice camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: defective view screen
Reviews.Author: beti
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the camera and bought a second one for my daughter.  Both camera's soon got black areas on the viewing screen making it impossible to view the subject.  I returned my daughters for a replacement but since mine was 3 months old Amazon would not replace it.  I mailed it to Fuji for their review.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: sweetpea 50
Reviews.Content: the camera took clear pictures and the video are crisp. over all the insructions on the CD are somewhat unclear to follow. You just have to play with the functions to get a real understanding of how to use the camera.

Reviews.Title: so far, so good
Reviews.Author: mom
Reviews.Content: we purchased this for my daughter and she loves it. We haven't had a chance to process any of the pictures, so I can't speak to the quality of resolution. What I do like is that after you take a picture, you can zoom in to a particular part of of the picture. The battery seems to last quite a while, but you will have to be careful where you carry it because of the "slide on" feature. my husband carried it in his pocket, the lens opened and drained the battery. When we used a camera case, we didn't have that problem. After a few lessons, she(8)is able to get through the menu and change the modes without any trouble.

Reviews.Title: Very Quick Shippment....difficult manipulation
Reviews.Author: Byer89
Reviews.Content: it was a very quick shipment, thx for the seller. Unfortunetly, using the camera is kind of dificult if compared to the Kodak ones, however it needs just to get used to it.

Reviews.Title: Very Unhappy
Reviews.Author: cmw
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in June and after 2 uses it would no longer take pictures.  I sent it in for repair and got it back with a scratched screen 3 months later.  I called and informed them of the screen and they told me they would have someone call me but never did.  The camera takes very bad and blurry video and the sound is static. The pictures are blurry and often appear orange.  This is not a good camera and the company will not stand by repairs.  Good luck if you try it but I would say don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Fujiflim finepix Z70
Reviews.Author: csingh8492
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to getting this camera because I loved the look and the fact that it was 12MP with a 5X zoom. I got it as a birthday gift and was horribly disappointed. The picture quality is Very poor! Blurred to be exact, and it takes a long time to focus. The most annoying problem is that no matter how much I adjust the settings or try to fix the resolution, at night time all the pics come out very dark even though the flash is on. I've wasted a lot of time over the phone with the fugi customer service ppl and now they want me to mail it in. This is supposed to be a new camera, I just wish it worked like one. I absolutely would NOT recommend this camera. I had an Olympus that was a 8MP with a 3X zoom and it worked so much better than what I have now. Please look at other options!

Reviews.Title: gift
Reviews.Author: Diane Marie "Diane Marie"
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift for my friend who broke her last one. Its a pretty color (her favorite) and takes good pictures.

Reviews.Title: Two words to Google...Zoom Error
Reviews.Author: Neil H. Schwartz
Reviews.Content: Just type in Zoom Error into Google and see the results...My fourth one in four years.  I had the replacement plan.

Reviews.Title: Satifatoriamente, entregada...
Reviews.Author: Jorge Luis
Reviews.Content: Quiero darla las gracias a Amazon.com por su servicio muy eficaz en su tienda online, satifatoriamente estoy por la entrega a su debido tiempo, gracias por su servicio.

Reviews.Title: not really bad.
Reviews.Author: C. Leneus
Reviews.Content: I like this camera a lot, I love the color it's very beautiful and the size is just great, it's hardly noticeable if u r snicky enough to want to take pictures like at some museum exhibit where u r told pictures were not allowed but that's what I had done. I snicked in some photos at a museum and that was one of the reason I purchased this camera, security never notice me. the pictures came out o.k. it's just that when you're in a dim lighting room u may have to change the camera's view mode so that u can get that clear bright viewing look in the picture and as for focusing view that too is also o.k. but don't expected to make a large wide shot because it will appear fuzzy so try to make it steady but be quick, the shooting is not fast so u better have a quick shooting finger like a wildwest gun shooter. Of it all, it's a really nice camera if u r looking for something just simple, stylish, and affordable than I recommend this is it, also fujifilm have a long history on the camera film company, it's a very popular bran you can't do no wrong on this one.

Reviews.Title: Bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: Yohn "yohn"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera that might get let among the other heavyweightsPros: very pocketable and I mean VERY pocketable  HD recording in 720p  Pictures come out decent most of the time  Price- very big plusCons: video capture needs more stabilization  Battery life could be better but I guess that's the trade-off for the sizeAll in all if you want a decent point and shoot for under a hundred dollars you can't go wrong with Z70

Reviews.Title: Mostly I am pleased with this camera
Reviews.Author: D. carr
Reviews.Content: I got this camera just before I left on vacation so I did not have time to read the booklet, what I found is that the majority of the information is on the CD.  I like the rechargeable battery, I like the size and ease of using this camera.  I don't like the fact that when you go to view your photos on the camera you have all this writing on the screen, they should have a clear screen to view your photos in.  But the main thing I did not like about this camera is that I could not download the pictures on my computer, I called the technical support # twice both times they went through the same steps to take, then said I needed someone in customer service, but they were closed. The second call I was transferred and on hold for over 30 minutes just to find out they closed even before I was transferred.  The third time the customer service person said I need a new computer and said more or less it was my problem not there's.  I spoke to three customer service/technical support representatives and everyone of them was extremely rude.  Needless to say I needed to call someone outside of this company to figure out how to download my pictures, I was told I need to get a card reader, thankfully they are inexpensive.  So where the camera is a good product, the service is not.

Reviews.Title: Fuji Finepix
Reviews.Author: Autumn Hunter
Reviews.Content: This camera was what I bought after dropping my Canon Powershot, which I loved.  I am not too happy with this camera.  I know that it is a hundred dollar camera, so you get what you pay for.  Indoor pictures are hit or miss.  Many turn out blurry, even with the flash on.  The video quality is okay, but doesn't seem like anything too special.  I haven't tweaked too many settings, for I was hoping for the auto mode to take care of more than it does.  I will give this camera an overall of: OKAY.  Nothing too impressive.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre performance, beware the warranty service
Reviews.Author: helenlam
Reviews.Content: The pictures that are taken are merely low to average quality. The flash really distorts the color and light balance in pictures. It actually does a pretty good job with pictures in night mode. The interface is pretty easy to use, but there is a long wait time between pictures. I had an issue with pixels burning out on the screen (two separate areas), sent it in to Fujifilm for repair while still under the 1 year warranty, and they refused to repair it due to 'impact damage'. The case was dinged in a corner yes, but the screen itself had absolutely no damage. Apparently if the camera has any damage, they will not repair any other areas even though it is totally unrelated to that damage. Additionally, the repair estimate was as much as buying it brand new! I was hoping to like this camera, but I won't be buying a Fujifilm camera again.

Reviews.Title: Z70
Reviews.Author: Kee "-"
Reviews.Content: This is not our first Fujifilm camera. This is our fourth and we have had two pink Z5's, one of which we still use. This is a newer, more modernized model. First of all, its very hard to see the buttons. My Mom has this one and said she cannot see the light white writing on the black buttons. There is also (as far as I can tell) no way to get back to the photo taking mecanism without turning off the camera. I have not found it yet and hope I can after some research. Its really annoying to have to turn the camera off all the time. Another feature that I cannot stand is that the movie button is so small and closely situated next to the photo taking button. We are always accidentally pushing that small button and realize we didn't get a photo taken because it was on movie the whole time.In conclusion, the Fujifilm Z5 which only has 6.x MP is far more superb to this one. Considering that the z5 is from 2008 it takes better pictures, has practical placed buttons, and is user friendly. Sadly, the z70 isn't user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Slow, slow, slow
Reviews.Author: B. Ung
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift from my family and returned it two weeks later.  I was wanting a small digital camera that I could throw in my purse and use for those spur of the moment situations.  Well, this camera started up so slow that I was missing it all anyway.  Also, I heard that it took good hd video so I thought I'd try it out on my daughter.  Well, it starts so slow that I had to have it recording before she came out for her piano recital, but then it couldn't get her in focus.  I guess you need to focus it on the subject, then start the video.  However, I would have missed half of her song.  I'm doing my research before I replace it with another.

Reviews.Title: Extremely disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Brown "Mother of an Angel"
Reviews.Content: I returned this camera after a week of extremely disappointing photos.I wanted to upgrade from my 6 megapixel Kodak easyshare one camera.Somehow my 6 mp camera takes much sharper pics than this supposed 12mp camera.I have tried numerous settings and had it set on the highest resolution.Pictures were frequently blurry.Also the video record button is next to the shutter release and easy to trigger accidentally.Also the camera does not come with a memory card and the internal memory would only store 3 photos.I do NOT recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: worst.camera.ever.
Reviews.Author: Kristine Johnson "Kay-rissy"
Reviews.Content: I dropped my last camera down a cliff, sadly, it was a Kodak and it was an amazing camera. Don't buy this camera. It will ruin your life. Most of the pictures are blurry..even if you are careful. I wish I could rate this a 0 out of 5 stars. Get a disposable camera instead of this one.

Reviews.Title: Camera I like
Reviews.Author: Marian J. Wouters "Monetfriend"
Reviews.Content: I haven't had a chance to use it as much as I would like, but what I have done I have very pleased with. Must say the thing I like the best is the size, I can take it everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Do not purchase!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Edwin
Reviews.Content: The Fujifilm FinePix Z70 was a bad choice for a camera. This was my first camera I have ever purchased and I am disappointed I choose the finepix Z70. One week after I bought the camera, it malfunctioned. A 'zoom error' appeared on my camera and I was unable to take pictures. I contacted fujifilm and it took them one month for them to fix my camera. First, I got an email from them 3 weeks after I shipped them the camera explaining that they have received the product. Second, they told me it would be about around week to figure out the problem. Third, around another week  to ship it back to me. I was also very upset that Fujifilm did not reimburse the money I payed for shipping them the camera because I was only able to use it for one week before it broke. Poor quality for a camera, poor service from fijifilm, and overall poor rating for my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Electronics Expo as a Vendor
Reviews.Author: Charlie Maus
Reviews.Content: Electronics Expo - I recently purchased a Fuji camera from this company.I would warn you that the decription on the item I purchased was in error.It listed the following:"Fujifilm FinePix 12.0MP Digital Camera with 4GB SDHC Card and Camera Case - Black Z70"What I received was the camera only.  When I contacted Electronics Expo They told methat I should read the description and it was only the camera that was listed.That was their answer!  So be warned, they do not stand behid thier offerings!!

Reviews.Title: Garbage, but cheap
Reviews.Author: Carlos A. Arguelles
Reviews.Content: In the interest of full disclosure, my other camera is a Canon 5D with six "L" lenses, probably worth about $10,000. So it might not be a fair comparison to write a review for a $70 camera. But this thing truly IS garbage. I am yet to see 3 photos in a row that are sharp. Noise is unbearable. Focus is a joke. The "12 megapixels" is also a joke. I'm seriously considering returning this garbage. It's by far the worst camera I've ever seen. Nice to have a tiny little camera for when I don't want to take the 5D out, but what's the point when 80% of your shots will be unusable?

Reviews.Title: Fugi Finepix Z70
Reviews.Author: Akira
Reviews.Content: I do not care for this camera. Its does not respond as well as my old Kodac camera I replace with this Fugi.

Reviews.Title: Broke after 4 weeks
Reviews.Author: kristen
Reviews.Content: My daughter saved for this camera and the latch for the battery already broke.  I wish I would have bought it a Target or something so that I could just return it...that is what I get for trying to save a little bit of money.  She is so sad.

Reviews.Title: So dissapointed with the product which had a dark line and big dark spot on the screen which was not mentioned under the product
Reviews.Author: Albert Chungong Funwi
Reviews.Content: I bought this Fujifilm camara from amazon and was so dissapointed in the product which does not even value my time to waste to return. This product came with a big dark spot and a dark line on the screen when the camara is turned on which was not what i was expecting because it was never mentioned that there was any thing wrong with the camara. I am so angry with amzon considering that i have been a regular customer buying stuff from them.

Reviews.Title: BE CAREFUL!
Reviews.Author: Chaim Cohen
Reviews.Content: I received this camera this afternoon, fully charged the battery, recorded some HD video, and two things:1) Within several videos, all on the "HD Setting", some of the videos were terrible quality, and most were good. This is probably on some wrong setting. Weird.2) MAJOR ISSUE! the microphone on this camera sucks! it hardly picks up anything from more than 2 feet away. I had to turn the audio to full blast on my laptop just to hear it at a normal level. What's really bad about this, is that you get a LOT of feedback, and that's basically all you hear. It could be that just mine is bad. All I know is I'm shipping this back to Amazon tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: not happy with AMAZON or fuji
Reviews.Author: Wendy
Reviews.Content: this product does not state that it REQUIRES a memory card to work at all. very disappointed in AMAZON and fuji. this ruined my Husbands 50th birthday getaway along with the holiday getway with all of the boys we combined it with.

Reviews.Title: DOES NOT WORK WITH EYE-FI Cards
Reviews.Author: Jeff S. Long "GEOFF"
Reviews.Content: Camera looks sharp, takes great pictures, budget oriented, UI isn't that terrible, SDHC compatible but...not with EYE-FI cards. Bummer, returning the camera solely for this reason.

ProductInfo.Features:
12-megapixel resolution for large, photo-quality prints
720p HD movie recording; one-touch movie button
5x optical zoom; Target Focus tracks a subject automatically
Photo tagging with automatic upload functions to YouTube and Facebook
Face Detection and Automatic Red-eye Removal
ProductInfo.Name: Fujifilm FinePix Z70 12 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Berry Red)
